availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph A. Hall (Marion County, Kentucky, postmaster, tavern keeper, and farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, postmaster, tavern keeper, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Nancy Maud Hall in Washington County, Kentucky, in April 1828. Father of Benjamin Hall and Maria A. Hall. Postmaster of Lebanon in Marion County from June 29, 1847, to August 19, 1853. Tavern keeper in Marion County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Marion County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 647.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 435.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film #000241382, p. 94.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Marion County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 676-77.
KYR-0001-017-0154.
